alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 21 at 12:58PM PDT until October 24 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...A long period south-southwest swell from 190 degrees and a west-northwest swell from 290 degrees will generate surf of 4 to 6 feet in San Diego County and 5 to 7 feet in Orange County. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Monday morning. Highest surf expected Sunday. * IMPACTS...Strong rip currents and longshore currents that will be hazardous to swimmers.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
